result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy Charles Hall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy Charles Hall appeared by video.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson appeared by video for Jimmy Charles Hall.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jimmy Charles Hall appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Jimmy Charles Hall.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court takes judicial notice of case 16CF4104. Sworn for the State: Samphanh Luangphaxayachack - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jimmy Charles Hall appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Jimmy Charles Hall.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a State v Lee hearing. Defense counsel was recently appointed and a State v Lee hearing is not needed. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Jimmy Charles Hall in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause. Case adjourned for State V Lee Hearing to Br 29.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/21/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Oral No Contact Order with A.H. (dob 3/27/2017).
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jimmy Charles Hall in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Oral Amendement: Count 1 should be AH not JCH. State will file an amended complaint.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
